channel.title: My Upgrade
channel.description:
So yeah, got bored of having shit comp so thought i might as well upgrade.
Sapphire HD 4850 512mb AMD Athlon X2 4800+ (2,5ghz dual-core) 6gb 800mhz ram 1tb buffalo external hdd 120gb samsung internal + 320gb seagate Biostar mobo with crossfire-support and built in hd 3300 gfx card for crossfire hybrid
Comments on setup please. I run every game maxed out with more than enough fps :)

item.title: My Upgrade
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

[quote=“Speljohan, post:17, topic:260710”]i’m not buying a new CPU until the next gen of AMD-cpus comes out (the Hybrid-cpu’s)[/quote]enjoy waiting a generation for AMD’s Fusion.

Read full topic

My mobo can’t handle a Phenom. + 5200+(2.7ghz one) was the cheapest option at the time.

item.description:
@chrisn2323 wrote:

you should’ve gotten a 6000+ or the phenom II

Read full topic

item.title: My Upgrade
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

For the next 1-2 days I will still have my old AMD 64 3500+ in my comp, which struggles with GTA-IV lowest settings. I hope that my 5200 will be better when I get it tomorrow or the day after in the mail.

Read full topic

item.title: My Upgrade
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“runescape3dude, post:12, topic:260710”]My computer only has 2gb ddr2 800. Yet I often hit 1.9GB usage when playing GTAIV

Here are my specs:

AMD 64 X2 5200+ ($60)
2GB DDR2 800 ($10)
Some DVD R±RW± 24X (free)
Two 80GB hard disks ($5 each)
One 200GB hard disk ($25)
Asus M2k-MV mobo ($40)
nVidia 8600GT, 1.3GB ($70)
350W PSU ($15)
Mercury case ($65)

so: $295[/quote]I love how cheap it is to get a great gaming-pc thesedays

Read full topic

item.title: My Upgrade
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

My computer only has 2gb ddr2 800. Yet I often hit 1.9GB usage when playing GTAIV

Here are my specs:

AMD 64 X2 5200+ ($60)
2GB DDR2 800 ($10)
Some DVD R±RW± 24X (free)
Two 80GB hard disks ($5 each)
One 200GB hard disk ($25)
Asus M2v-Mx mobo ($40)
nVidia 8600GT, 1.3GB ($70)
350W PSU ($15)
Mercury case ($65)

so: $295

Read full topic

item.title: My Upgrade
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:7, topic:260710”]I think nvidia is better than ATI, and you will never use 6gb of ram. Otherwise it’s not bad. ;)[/quote]I don’t give a shit about what manufacturer is behind the gfx card, i take what’s best price vs performance at the time.

[quote=“xEnt, post:9, topic:260710”]2gb ram is fine, 4 would have been average, 6gb is useless. I use a shitload of programs and i never use over 2gb, thats on vista even running crysis etc. Should have cut down on the ram and brought a better cpu, thats a huge bottleneck for that pc.[/quote]I should have mentioned the cpu isn’t brand new. Had it for a year or so now. I did the RAM-upgrade cause it’s very useful when you have 2-3 IDE’s up + listening to music + surfing the web, and it’s dirt cheap. The CPU does fine for now.

Read full topic

item.title: My Upgrade
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

Like the Gfx card. I went for the 1gb, since it was like $20 more.

Read full topic

item.title: My Upgrade
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

2gb ram is fine, 4 would have been average, 6gb is useless. I use a shitload of programs and i never use over 2gb, thats on vista even running crysis etc. Should have cut down on the ram and brought a better cpu, thats a huge bottleneck for that pc.

Read full topic

item.title: My Upgrade
item.dc:creator: @chrisn2323 chrisn2323
item.description:
@chrisn2323 wrote:

upgrade that processor. I got a 6000+ brisbane for $75. AMD is very good at being backwards compatible. You could probably put the 940 phenom II in your mobo so if you want a better processor you can certainly get it.

Read full topic

item.title: My Upgrade
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I think nvidia is better than ATI, and you will never use 6gb of ram. Otherwise it’s not bad.

Read full topic
